channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI is already touching nearly every corner of the medical field
item.description: Some universities are already incorporating AI training into their medical school courses.

item.title: In-N-Out heiress doubles down on California staying company’s HQ, but says Tennessee office opening allows staff better chances to buy a home
item.description: Snyder emphasized her deep ties to California and the brand’s heritage, but cited cost-of-living challenges as a reason for offering employees new opp...

item.title: Trump Administration Plans to Speed Up A.I. Development
item.description: In an “A.I. Action Plan,” the White House outlined steps it said would promote American dominance in the fast-growing technology.

item.title: JD Vance Knows Who Belongs
item.description: The vice president envisions a world of tiered citizenship, where entry depends on heritage and status rests on obedience.

item.title: Billionaire Mark Cuban reads around 700 emails every day in his quest for near inbox zero—and prefers that to ‘boring’ meetings
item.description: The billionaire ex-’Shark Tank’ investor checks his inbox between workouts, Zoom meetings, and meals—and he’d never outsource the job to an assistant.

item.title: DeepSeek makes it easier for Southeast Asia’s firms to get into AI, but venture investors are still adopting a wait-and-see attitude
item.description: Granite Asia’s Jixun Foo wants to see “the confluence of talent and market adoption” before he starts investing in Southeast Asian AI.

item.title: A Minnesota Mamdani? A Race for Mayor Has Echoes, but Only So Far.
item.description: Omar Fateh, a young democratic socialist, beat out an establishment Democrat for the party’s endorsement in Minneapolis. But the parallels with Zohran...

item.title: Aid Groups Blame Israel’s Gaza Restrictions for ‘Mass Starvation’
item.description: More than 100 organizations, including Save the Children and Doctors Without Borders, added to growing calls for aid restrictions to be eased and the ...

item.title: Deferring to Trump, Senate Pulls Back on New Russia Sanctions
item.description: Republican leaders said they were ready to vote as soon as this month on punishing penalties against Moscow but have paused after President Trump thre...

item.title: Chocolate cravings are about to be costlier as Hershey’s confirms price increases are on the way
item.description: Tariffs, however, are not to blame this time.

item.title: New Global Atlas Highlights Surprising Hot Spots of Fungal Biodiversity
item.description: A new global atlas of underground fungi suggests that some surprising biodiversity hot spots lie hidden beneath our feet.

item.title: Thousands Protest After Ukraine Weakens Anticorruption Agencies

item.title: Something Like Feathers Grew on a 247-Million-Year-Old Reptile
item.description: The discovery, in a bizarre animal not closely related to birds, could change how scientists think about the origin of feathers.

item.title: American Convicted of Murder Among Those Trump Rescued From Venezuela Prison
